Pittsburgh.Carnegie Mellon School of Architecture: The Carnegie Mellon School of Architecture in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania is a degree-granting institution founded in 1906 as one of five divisions of Carnegie Mellon University's College of Fine Arts. It is widely regarded as one of the best schools of architecture, and one of a shrinking number offering the B.Arch accredited five-year professional degree. The School of Architecture's slogan is 'Where Art and Technology Meet Practice', and the current head of the school is Stephen Lee.
